title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: I then passed on for a stroll. The post office is situated at the bottom of Market Street, and next to it is the Douglas Hotel. At this place I found the landlord or proprietor, a congenial and kind man, and soon an arrangement was struck for my letters to be addressed to his hotel.

title: England from a Back-Window; with views of Scotland and Ireland
author: Bailey, James Montgomery.
snippet: Edinburgh has one institution that can be found nowhere else in the United Kingdom: it is two quarts of peanuts. They are in a store-window on Market Street, and have probably been there for years. I was startled on beholding them.

title: Robert Urquhart. [A novel.]
author: Setoun, Gabriel
snippet: It hung about the street-lights, dimming them to a fungus yellow, and blotting them out entirely beyond the fourth lamp-post; it clung to the pavement mucky and greasy. At the corner of Cockburn Street and Market Street a crowd of young fellows stood talking, seven of them in all. They were well protected against cold and wet, and talk, for the time being, rendered them oblivious of damp or discomfort.

title: The life of Samuel Johnson, LL. D. :
author: Boswell, James
snippet: § The following circumstance, mutually to the honour of Johnson and the corporation of his native city, has been communicated to me by the Reverend Dr. Vyse, from the Town Clerk: *• Mr. Simpson has now before him a reooni of the respect and veneration which the Corporation of Lichfield, in the year 1767, had for the merits and learning of Dr. Johnson. His father built the corner house in the Market Place, the two fronts of which, towards Market and Broad Market Street, stood upon
